findings.title: OTUT - Transfers User's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer the balance of a user's address to the owner's address.

findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract operator has the authority to mint tokens, allowing the owner to take advantage of it by calling the `mint` function, resulting in highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Check
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape. These variables may produce vulnerability issues.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant as it does not modify the state of the contract and does not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: DPI - Decimals Precision Inconsistency
findings.description: Inconsistency in handling decimals field of ERC20 token can cause problems when interacting with contracts, leading to unexpected results.

findings.title: PPI - Potential Precision Issue
findings.description: A variable is being cast from a higher precision data type to a lower precision data type, causing potential loss of information and unexpected results.

findings.title: MVN - Misleading Variables Naming
findings.description: Variables can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the value they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: MCN - Misleading Contract Naming
findings.description: Contract can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the functionality they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: RC - Redundant Comments
findings.description: The current implementation of the contract contains numerous comments that add little value to the codebase.

findings.title: MCM - Misleading Comment Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading comment messages that do not accurately reflect the actual implementation, making it difficult to understand the source code.

findings.title: UCV - Unutilized Contract Variable
findings.description: The contract contains variables that are calculated but not used in subsequent code blocks, leading to wasted computation and unnecessary gas costs, as well as potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: RCS - Redundant Code Statement
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized. A segment may be optimized so that it becomes a smaller size, consumes less memory, executes more rapidly, or performs fewer operations.

findings.title: TAP - Transfer Amount Prevalidation
findings.description: The current implementation of the contract does not prevalidate whether sufficient tokens are available to perform transactions, which can lead to transaction failures or unexpected behavior.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure that the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can lead to poor readability and maintainability.
